item.title: Wolf deer analogy
item.description: Source: Sankrant Sanu here. Some wolves were let loose among a pack of deer. They hunted in a pack as habitual predators, and started killing off the deer, picking on the young and vulnerable first. The deer appealed to the State for protection. State said wolves are a minority, they will be protected. But but said the deer, it is we who need protection. We do not interfere with the wolves, we leave them alone, but they don’t.
